name: Copyright Registration
shortDescription: Copyright (or author’s right) is a legal term used to describe the rights that creators have over their literary and artistic works.
description: Copyright (or author’s right) is a legal term used to describe the rights that creators have over their literary and artistic works. Works covered by copyright range from books, music, paintings, sculpture, and films, to computer programs. Registration grants individual rights to distribute, replicate, reproduce the work or give authorization to another entity.

content.title: Copyright Infringement
content.description: Copyright protection enables the holder of the copyright to take legal action. When an unauthorized person uses a copyright it is known as infringement.

content.title: Legal Protection
content.description: Copyright protects the rights of the owner and the original works. It protects the original work against piracy. It prevents losses arising from copies being made of the original work.

content.title: Ownership Rights
content.description: Registering the copyright ensures and gives you exclusive rights to operate and market under said copyright. It can also prevent its unauthorized use by any third party or individual.

content.title: Valuable Asset
content.description: Intellectual property is an intangible asset and registered copyright is an intellectual property that can be sold, franchised, and contracted commercially.

faqs.question: Who can apply for Copyright registration?
faqs.answer: Any individual or business can apply for copyright registration. The individual can be an artist, author, photographer, musician or creator.

faqs.question: What law governs copyright registration in India?
faqs.answer: The registration of copyright is governed by The Copyright Act 1957

faqs.question: What is an artistic work?
faqs.answer: An artistic work means-a painting, a sculpture, a drawing (including a diagram, map, chart or plan), an engraving or a photograph, whether or not any such work possesses artistic quality.

faqs.question: Whose rights are protected by copyright?
faqs.answer: Copyright protects the rights of authors, i.e., creators of intellectual property in the form of literary, musical, dramatic and artistic works and cinematograph films and sound recordings.

faqs.question: If I have questions regarding my documents or the process, how can I ask?
faqs.answer: Once you purchase any product from the ezyLegal website, you will be credited minutes in your account. You can use these minutes to connect with the Lawyer and ask questions and take guidance from the Expert.

faqs.question: How to register a copyright in India?
faqs.answer: ezyLegal can help you get your copyright registered and provide you with the right legal guidance. You can schedule your Consultation with an ezyLegal Lawyer and know the detailed process and advantages of registering a copyright.

faqs.question: How will I know the status of the registration process?
faqs.answer: Status updates will be available on the ezyLegal website (www.ezylegal.in) in your secured Account. Additionally, you will be notified on email and WhatsApp.
